item.title: Publications
item.description: function collapse(tid){ var content = document.querySelector('#'+tid); if(!content) return if (content.style.display === "block") { content.style.display = "none"; } else { content.style.display = "block"; } } window.addEventListener('load', function () { bbs = document.querySelectorAll('.highlight_tg') for(var i = 0; i 0){ collapse(hash+'_abstract'); collapse(hash+'_bibtex'); } }, false); Journal Articles (3 + 2 in progress) S. H. H. Ding, B. C. M. Fung, F. Iqbal, and W. K. Cheung. Learning stylometric representations for authorship analysis.

Teaching 2018-winter - GLIS 630: Data Mining @ McGill University [53 students] Requirement: GLIS 617 – Information System Design, or basic knowledge of database systems. Data mining: This course will cover association rules mining, classification analysis, cluster analysis, text mining, basic concepts and methods of frequent patterns mining, online analytical mining (OLAM), online analytical processing (OLAP), and datawarehouse architecture. The goal is to develop new data analytic skills as well as a data-oriented problem solving perspective.

item.title: About Me
item.description: p{ /* text-align: justify; */ } I am a Ph.D. candidate at McGill University, School of Information Studies since 2014. I am fortunate to be supervised by Dr. Benjamin C. M. Fung and work with him as well as other excellent colleagues in the Data Mining and Security Lab (DMaS). My research bridges the area of data mining, machine learning, and security. Under this umbrella, I design novel data mining and machine learning models and develop them as practical software applications that address critical issues in reverse engineering and cybercrime investigation.
